Cardano Mercury: Invoice Documentation

Postman collection → OpenAPI spec →

Introduction

Base URL: http://localhost:8100

This documentation aims to provide all the information you need to work with our API.

As you scroll, you'll see code examples for working with the API in different programming languages in the dark area to the right (or as part of the content on mobile). You can switch the language used with the tabs at the top right (or from the nav menu at the top left on mobile).

Authenticating requests

To authenticate requests, include an Authorization header with the value "Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}".

All authenticated endpoints are marked with a requires authentication badge in the documentation below.

You can generate your token by logging in and clicking your name, and then API Tokens.

Customers

Customer Management API

List Customers

GET
http://localhost:8100
/api/v1/customers
requires authentication

Headers

Authorization
Example:
Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}
Content-Type
Example:
application/json
Accept
Example:
application/json

Query Parameters

search
string

Search for customers by name or tax number

Example:
John Doe
per_page
integer

Number of results per page (Min 25, Max 100)

Example:
25
page
integer

Page number

Example:
1
Auth
:
Bearer
Headers
:
:
Query Parameters
:
:
:
Request failed with error

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network. If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS. You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Received response

Example request: 
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers?search=John+Doe&per_page=25&page=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers"
);

const params = {
    "search": "John Doe",
    "per_page": "25",
    "page": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'search' => 'John Doe',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'page' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers'
params = {
  'search': 'John Doe',
  'per_page': '25',
  'page': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Create Customer

POST
http://localhost:8100
/api/v1/customers
requires authentication

Headers

Authorization
Example:
Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}
Content-Type
Example:
application/json
Accept
Example:
application/json

Body Parameters

name
string
required

Must be at least 3 characters. Must not be greater than 64 characters.

Example:
John Doe
tax_number
string

Must be at least 3 characters. Must not be greater than 64 characters.

Example:
ABCD-1234
tax_rate
number

Must be between 0 and 100.

Example:
12.5
Auth
:
Bearer
Headers
:
:
Body
{ "name": "John Doe", "tax_number": "ABCD-1234", "tax_rate": 12.5 }
Request failed with error

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network. If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS. You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Received response

Example request: 
curl --request POST \
    "http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"John Doe\",
    \"tax_number\": \"ABCD-1234\",
    \"tax_rate\": 12.5
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "tax_number": "ABCD-1234",
    "tax_rate": 12.5
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'John Doe',
            'tax_number' => 'ABCD-1234',
            'tax_rate' => 12.5,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

curl --request PUT \
    "http://localhost:8100/api/v1/customers/1" \

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"John Doe\",
    \"tax_number\": \"ABCD-1234\",
    \"tax_rate\": 12.5
}"

search
string

Example:

per_page
integer

Number of results per page (Min 25, Max 100)

25

integer

Page number

curl --request GET \

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
